typedef.name: ApiHandsetIdType
typedef.description: This type is used to hold a handset id.

struct.name: ApiModelIdType
struct.description: This struct is used to specify the Model ID type.

member.name: MANIC
member.description: The manufacturer code of the device. The EMC code of the device is used as manufacturer code.

member.name: MODIC
member.description: The model code of the device.

enum.name: ApiDectTypeType
enum.description: This enum defines the DECT types supported by the API.

member.name: API_US_DECT_EXT_FREQ
member.description: US DECT mode with extended freq band.

member.name: API_JAPAN_DECT
member.description: Japan DECT with 2 channels mode. (In Pp used for 2 and 5 channels mode)

member.name: API_JAPAN_DECT_5CH
member.description: Japan DECT with PHS and 5 channels mode.

enum.name: ApiCradleStatusType
enum.description: This enum defines the status of the cradle detection to the MMI

struct.name: ApiTimeDateCodeType
struct.description: This struct is used to hold both time and date info.

member.name: TimeZone
member.description: The Time Zone indicates the difference, expressed in quarters of an hour, between the local time and GMT. In the first of the two semi-octets, the first bit represents the algebraic sign of this difference (0: positive; 1: negative). The Time Zone code enables the receiver to calculate the equivalent time in GMT from the other semi-octets in the element, or indicate the time zone (GMT, GMT+1H, etc.), or perform other similar calculations as required by the implementation.

enum.name: ApiTimeDateInterpretationType
enum.description: See ETSI EN 300 175-5, TIME-DATE information element

member.name: API_INTER_TIME_DURATION
member.description: Time duration (in Years, Months, Days and/or Hours, Minutes, Seconds, Time Zone = 0)

member.name: API_INTER_DELIVER_MMS_MSG
member.description: The time/date at which to start forwarding/delivering the MMS message

member.name: API_INTER_MMS_DATA_CREATED
member.description: The time/date the MMS user data was created

member.name: API_INTER_MMS_DATA_MODIFIED
member.description: The time/date the MMS user data was last modified

member.name: API_INTER_MCE_DATA_RECIEVED
member.description: The time/date the message was received by the MCE

member.name: API_INTER_DATA_ACCESSED_END
member.description: The time/date the message was delivered/accessed by the End Entity

member.name: API_INTER_TIME_DATE_STAMP_ID
member.description: The time/date stamp for use as an identifier

enum.name: ApiTimeDateCodingType
enum.description: See ETSI EN 300 175-5, TIME-DATE information element

enum.description: This enum defies the signal types supported.

member.name: API_WIDEBAND_SPEECH
member.description: Wideband speech using default setup attributes.

member.name: API_LDS_CLASS3
member.description: Light data services: SUOTA (TS 102 527-4 [76]), Class 3 DPRS management using default setup attributes.

member.name: API_BS_OTHER
member.description: The service is defined by adding <<IWU-ATTRIBUTES>> + <<CALL-ATTRIBUTES>> elements to the {CC-SETUP} message.

enum.name: ApiNpiType
enum.description: This enum defines the numbering planes supported. NOTE: If ANPI_SIP is selected the SIP interface must check the called number. If the number already contains sip: the SIP interface shall pass the number unchanged. Otherwise the SIP interface must form the number as specified in RFC 3261. (E.g. sip:number@xxx.yyy). Also see EN 300 175-5 section 7.7.7.

member.name: ANPI_SIP
member.description: SIP addressing scheme, To: or From: field (see RFC 3261)

enum.name: ApiPresentationIndicatorType
enum.description: This enum defines the presentation indicator values that can be used on calling name and number received from the network. Also see EN 300 175-5 section 7.7.9.

member.name: API_PRESENTATION_HANSET_LOCATOR
member.description: Used to locate physically handsets (have them ring) f. ex.by pressing a physical or logical button on the FP.

enum.name: ApiScreeningIndicatorType
enum.description: This enum defines the presentation indicator values that can be used on calling name received from the network. Also see EN 300 175-5 section 7.7.53.

enum.name: ApiUsedAlphabetType
enum.description: This enum defines the string coding formats that can be used to encode strings exchanged between the MCU and the handsets.

struct.name: ApiCalledNumberType
struct.description: This type is used to hold information about the number called / dialled on a handset.

member.name: Number
member.description: The number as IA5 string (NumberLength number of bytes).

struct.name: ApiCalledNameType
struct.description: This type is used to hold information about the name of called / dialled number on a handset. The Screening indicator is always set to either User-provided or Network provided.

member.name: UsedAlphabet
member.description: Specifies the encoding of the name.

member.name: Name
member.description: The name(s) (NameLength number of bytes + FirstNameLength number of bytes).

struct.name: ApiCallingNumberType
struct.description: This is used to present the calling party number. This is also used in intercom call setup to identify the calling handset. For the coding of the Calling party number IE see [3] section F.1.3.2 Internal Call CLIP procedure description. The Presentation indicator is always set to Presentation allowed and the Screening indicator is always set to User-provided, not screened.

member.name: Number
member.description: The number as IA5 string (NumberLength number of bytes).

struct.name: ApiCallingNameType
struct.description: This type is used to hold information about the number called / dialled on a handset. The Presentation indicator is always set to Presentation allowed and the Screening indicator is always set to User-provided, not screened

member.name: UsedAlphabet
member.description: Specifies the encoding of the name.

struct.description: This type is used for sending system Call id in an API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID information element.

member.name: API_CSS_CALL_REMOTE_HOLD
member.description: Call status of the call on remote party side

member.name: API_CSS_CALL_REMOTE_CONNECT
member.description: Call status of the call on remote party side

enum.name: ApiCallStatusReasonType
enum.description: Call status reason for failure.

struct.name: ApiCallStatusType
struct.description: This type is used for sending call status.

struct.name: ApiCallStatusListType
struct.description: This type is used for sending call status in an API_IE_CALL_STATUS information element.

struct.name: ApiAvailableApiBitsType
struct.description: Set of APIs available.

enum.name: ApiAudioDataFormatType
enum.description: This enum defines the CODEC's (PCM data format) supported by the FP on the PCM interface.

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_LINEAR_8kHz
member.description: Linear PCM, 8kHz sample rate. Used for narrowband calls (G.726).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_LINEAR_16kHz
member.description: Linear PCM, 16kHz sample rate. Used for wideband calls (G.722).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_G722
member.description: G.722 - Sub-band ADPCM, 16 KHz sample rate.

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_G711A
member.description: G.711 - A-law, 8 KHz sample rate. Used for narrowband calls (G.726).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_G711U
member.description: G.711 - u-law, 8 KHz sample rate. Used for narrowband calls (G.726).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_CWB_ALAW
member.description: Compressed wideband using A-law, 16 KHz sample rate. The 16 bit PCM data is encoded as two 8 bit audio samples if 8 KHz frame sync is used. Used for wideband calls (G.722).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_CWB_ULAW
member.description: Compressed wideband using u-law, 16 KHz sample rate. The 16 bit PCM data is encoded as two 8 bit audio samples if 8 KHz frame sync is used. Used for wideband calls (G.722).

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_CWB_ALAW_REVERSE_BYTEORDER
member.description: Same as CWB_ALAW, but with reverse byte order on PCM bus. MSB is most recent sample.

member.name: AP_DATA_FORMAT_CWB_ULAW_REVERSE_BYTEORDER
member.description: Same as CWB_ULAW, but with reverse byte order on PCM bus. LSB is most recent sample.

struct.name: ApiAudioDataFormatInfoType
struct.description: This struct defines the relation between the encoding used on the air interface between the FP and the PP and the audio format delivered to the host.

struct.name: ApiAudioDataFormatListType
struct.description: The relationship between codec and audio format to the host must be given for all offered codecs when a call is established. This information has to be given from the host to the FP target once before the audio is connected. The FP target needs to know which audio data format it shall deliver to the external audio interface (f.ex PCM bus) at the time the audio is connected. It can be delivered in one of the following messages: API_FP_CC_SETUP_REQ, API_FP_CC_SETUP_ACK_REQ, API_FP_CC_ALERT_REQ, API_FP_CC_CALL_PROC_REQ, API_FP_CC_CONNECT_REQ, API_FP_CC_CONNECT_RES.

struct.name: ApiGuidType
struct.description: Standard GUID.

struct.name: ApiBasicTermCapsType
struct.description: Basic PP terminal capabilites. See ETSI EN 300 175-5 section 7.7.41.

member.name: Flags0
member.description: Bit0: Wideband Voice. Bit1: Extended Wideband Voice. Bit2: Headset Management. Bit3: Early Encryption. Bit4: Associated Melody. Bit5: Unused. Bit6: Unused. Bit7: Unused.

member.name: Flags1
member.description: Bit0: DPRS Class 3. Bit1: DPRS Class 4. Bit2: Light Data Services. Bit3: Unused. Bit4: Unused. Bit5: Unused. Bit6: Unused. Bit7: Unused.

member.name: EchoParameters
member.description: 0x0: N/A. 0x1: Minimum TCLw. 0x2: TCLw > 46 dB. 0x3: TCLw > 55 dB.

struct.name: ApiTermCapsType
struct.description: PP terminal capabilites. See ETSI EN 300 175-5 section 7.7.41.

member.name: Byte3
member.description: Bit 0-3: Display capabilities Bit 4-6: Tone Capabilities

member.name: Byte3b
member.description: Bit 0-1: A-VOL Bit 2-3: N-REJ Bit 4-6: Echo parameters

member.name: Byte4
member.description: Profile indicator_1 Bit 0: CAP supported Bit 1: GAP supported Bit 2: DECT/GSM interworking profile supported Bit 3: ISDN End-system supported Bit 4: LRMS supported Bit 5: DPRS Stream supported Bit 6: DPRS asymmetric bearers supported

member.name: Byte4a
member.description: Profile indicator_2 Bit 0: DPRS Class 2 management and B-field procedures supported Bit 1: Data Services Profile D, Class 2 supported Bit 2: ISDN Intermediate Access Profile supported Bit 3: DECT/UMTS-GSM interworking - UMTS-GSM Bearer service supported Bit 4: DECT/UMTS-GSM interworking - UMTS-GSM SMS service supported Bit 5: DECT/UMTS-GSM interworking - UMTS-GSM Facsimile service supported Bit 6: RAP 1 Profile supported

member.name: Byte4b
member.description: Profile indicator_3 Bit 0: DECT/GSM dual mode terminal Bit 1: WRS supported Bit 2: SMS over LRMS supported Bit 3: DMAP supported Bit 4: Multiport CTA Bit 5: Ethernet supported Bit 6: Token Ring supported

member.name: Byte4c
member.description: Profile indicator_4 Bit 0: IP supported Bit 1: PPP supported Bit 2: V.24 supported Bit 3: CF supported Bit 4: IPQ services supported Bit 5: RAP 2 Profile supported Bit 6: Generic Media Encapsulation transport (DPRS) supported

member.name: Byte4d
member.description: Profile indicator_5 Bit 0: 2-level modulation scheme supported (B+Z field) Bit 1: 4-level modulation scheme supported (B+Z field) Bit 2: 8-level modulation scheme supported (B+Z field) Bit 3: 16-level modulation scheme supported (B+Z field) Bit 4: 2-level modulation scheme supported (A field) Bit 5: 4-level modulation scheme supported (A field) Bit 6: 8-level modulation scheme supported (A field)

member.name: Byte4e
member.description: Profile indicator_6 Bit 0: DECT/UMTS interworking profile supported Bit 1: DECT/UMTS interworking - GPRS services supported Bit 2: Basic ODAP supported Bit 3: F-MMS Interworking profile supported Bit 4: Channel GF supported Bit 5: PT with fast hopping radio Bit 6: Capability to support "no emission" mode

member.name: Byte4f
member.description: Profile indicator_7 Bit 0: 64-level modulation scheme supported (B+Z field) Bit 1: NG-DECT Part 1: Wideband voice supported Bit 2: Support of NG-DECT Part 3 Bit 3: Support of the "Headset management" feature Bit 4: Support of "Re-keying" and "default cipher key early encryption mechanism" Bit 5: Support of 'associated melody' per contact Bit 6: Support of NG-DECT Part 5

member.name: Byte4g
member.description: Profile indicator_8 Bit 0: E+U-type mux and channel IPF basic procedures supported Bit 1: Channel IPF advanced procedures supported Bit 2: Channel SIPF supported Bit 3-6: DPRS/NG-DECT Packet Data Category:

member.name: Byte4h
member.description: Profile indicator_9 Bit 0: DPRS Class 3 management and A-field procedures (DPRS-M.30) supported Bit 1: DPRS Class 4 management and A-field procedures (DPRS-M.30) supported Bit 2: Reserved for DECT ULE Bit 3: Reserved for DECT ULE Bit 4: Reserved for DECT ULE Bit 5: Support of Light data services Bit 6: Reserved

member.name: Byte4i
member.description: Profile indicator_10 Bit 0: Support of "Date and Time recovery" procedure in NG-DECT Part 5 Bit 1: Support of "Extended list change indication" procedure Bit 2-6: Reserved

member.name: Byte5
member.description: Bit 0-2: Control codes Bit 3: 0 Bit 4: 0 Bit 5: DSC2 Bit 6: DSAA2

member.name: Byte6
member.description: Bit 0: sp4 Bit 1: sp3 Bit 2: sp2 Bit 3: sp1 Bit 4: sp0 Bit 5-6: Blind slot indication

member.name: Byte6a
member.description: Bit 0: sp11 Bit 1: sp10 Bit 2: sp9 Bit 3: sp8 Bit 4: sp7 Bit 5: sp6 Bit 6: sp5

struct.name: ApiFpCapabilitiesType
struct.description: Fixed Part Capabilities

member.name: FpCapBit12_15
member.description: FP capabilities a12-a15 Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: reserved Bit 4: reserved Bit 3: a12 Extended fixed part info Bit 2: a13 Double duplex bearer connections Bit 1: a14 Reserved Bit 0: a15 Double slot

member.name: FpCapBit16_23
member.description: FP capabilities a16-a23 Bit 7: a16 Half slot Bit 6: a17 Full slot Bit 5: a18 Frequency control Bit 4: a19 Page repetition Bit 3: a20 C/O setup on dummy allowed Bit 2: a21 C/L uplink Bit 1: a22 C/L downlink Bit 0: a23 Basic A-field set up

member.name: FpCapBit24_31
member.description: FP capabilities a24-a31 Bit 7: a24 Advanced A-field set up Bit 6: a25 B-field set up Bit 5: a26 CF messages Bit 4: a27 IN_minimum delay Bit 3: a28 IN_normal_delay Bit 2: a29 IP_error_detection Bit 1: a30 IP_error_correction Bit 0: a31 Multibearer connections

member.name: FpCapBit32_39
member.description: FP capabilities a32-a49 Bit 7: a32 ADPCM/G.721 Voice service Bit 6: a33 GAP/PAP basic speech Bit 5: a34 Non-voice circuit switched service Bit 4: a35 Non-voice packet switched service Bit 3: a36 Standard authentication required Bit 2: a37 Standard ciphering supported Bit 1: a38 Location registration supported Bit 0: a39 SIM services available

member.name: FpCapBit40_47
member.description: FP capabilities a40-a47 Bit 7: a40 Non-static Fixed Part (FP) Bit 6: a41 CISS service available Bit 5 a42 CLMS service available Bit 4: a43 COMS service available Bit 3: a44 Access rights requests supported Bit 2: a45 External handover supported Bit 1: a46 Connection handover supported Bit 0: a47 Reserved

struct.name: ApiFpExtendedCapabilitiesType

member.name: FpExtCapBit12_15
member.description: FP Extended capabilities a12-a15 Bit 7: reserved Bit 6: reserved Bit 5: reserved Bit 4: reserved Bit 3: a12 CRFP Hops Bit 2: a13 CRFP is allowed Bit 1: a14 CRFP encryption: CRFP encryption supported Bit 0: a15 REP Hosp: REP not supported

member.name: FpExtCapBit16_23
member.description: FP Extended capabilities a16-a23 Bit 7: a16 REP Hosp: REP not supported Bit 6: a17 REP capabilities: REP not supported Bit 5: a18 Synchronization fiels options: Prolonged preamble Bit 4: a19 Synchronization fiels options: Prolonged preamble Bit 3: a20 Reserved Bit 2: a21 MAC suspend and resume Bit 1: a22 Ipq services supported Bit 0: a23 Extended FP info part 2

member.description: FP Extended capabilities a24-a31 Bit 7: a24 Reserved Bit 6: a25 F-MMS Interworking profile supported Bit 5: a26 Basic ODAP supported Bit 4: a27 Generic Media Encapsulation transport (DPRS) Bit 3: a28 IP Roaming unrestricted supported Bit 2: a29 Ethernet Bit 1: a30 Token Ring Bit 0: a31 IP

member.name: FpExtCapBit32_39

member.name: FpExtCapBit40_47

member.description: FP Extended capabilities a16-a23 Bit 7: a16 Reserved for future standardization Bit 6: a17 Reserved for future standardization Bit 5: a18 Reserved for future standardization Bit 4: a19 Reserved for future standardization Bit 3: a20 Reserved for future standardization Bit 2: a21 Reserved for future standardization Bit 1: a22 Reserved for future standardization Bit 0: a23 Reserved for future standardization

member.name: FpExtCap2Bit24_31
member.description: FP Extended capabilities a24-a31 Bit 7: a24 NG-DECT Wideband voice Bit 6: a25 NG-DECT Packet Data Category Bit 5: a26 NG-DECT Packet Data Category Bit 4: a27 NG-DECT Packet Data Category Bit 3: a28 NG-DECT Packet Data Category Bit 2: a29 NG-DECT Extended wideband voice supported Bit 1: a30 NG-DECT Extended voice: Permanent CLIR Bit 0: a31 NG-DECT Extended voice: Third party conference call (external or internal)

member.name: FpExtCap2Bit32_39
member.description: FP Extended capabilities a32-a49 Bit 7: a32 NG-DECT Extended voice: Intrusion call Bit 6: a33 NG-DECT Extended voice: Call deflection Bit 5: a34 NG-DECT Extended voice:Multiple lines Bit 4: a35 No emission mode supported Bit 3: a36 Additional feature set nr.1 for extended wideband voice supported Bit 2: a37 Reserved Bit 1: a38 Reserved Bit 0: a39 Reserved for DECT ULE

member.name: FpExtCap2Bit40_47
member.description: FP Extended capabilities a40-a47 Bit 7: a40 Reserved for DECT ULE Bit 6: a41 Reserved for DECT ULE Bit 5: a42 Support of Re.keying and early encryption Bit 4: a43 DSAA2 supported Bit 3: a44 DSC2 supported Bit 2: a45 light data services supported Bit 1: a46 Reserved Bit 0: a47 Reserved

struct.name: ApiAudioExtIndexType
struct.description: This type is used to select tone melody index for the API_PP_AUDIO_START_TONE_EXT_REQ and API_PP_AUDIO_START_MIDI_EXT_REQ

member.name: ExtIndex
member.description: Index of tones and melodies The index refferes to the project specific melody/midi table in the stack, holding predefined melodies

struct.name: ApiAudioExtPointerType
struct.description: This type is used to select tone melody location for the API_PP_AUDIO_START_TONE_EXT_REQ and API_PP_AUDIO_START_MIDI_EXT_REQ

member.name: *ExtPointer
member.description: Pointer to address of tones and melodies. The custom tones and melodies are intended to be programmed in flash (fx. in the COLA area)

struct.name: ApiAudioExtArrayType
struct.description: This type is used to send an array of tone data for the API_PP_AUDIO_START_TONE_EXT_REQ and API_PP_AUDIO_START_MIDI_EXT_REQ

member.name: ExtArray[1]
member.description: Array of tone and melody data. See programming guide for examples on how to program.

enum.name: ApiMmSignalType
enum.description: This type defines the signal types received when receiving alert broadcast

enum.name: ApiMmSearchModeType
enum.description: This type defines the signal types received when receiving alert broadcast

enum.name: ApiMmLocationStatusType
enum.description: This type defines the handset location status.

member.name: API_MM_LS_UNKNOWN
member.description: Unknown location status. Handset may or may not be able to make calls.

member.name: API_MM_LS_LOCATED
member.description: Handset has performed location update and is probably able to make calls.

defines.name: API_LINEID_INFO_NDT RSBIT0
defines.value: Network delay type 0 ~ connected to a network with low delay (e.g. PSTN/ISDN) 1 ~ connected to a network with significant delay (e.g. VoIP)
defines.description: The ApiLineIdInfoType is a bitarray, with the following defines.

defines.name: API_LINEID_INFO_SCT RSBIT1
defines.value: Second call type 0 ~ Second calls are handled with 'common parallel call procedures' (e.g. VoIP lines) 1 ~ Second calls are handled with in-band signalling (e.g. PSTN lines)

defines.name: API_LINEID_NONE 0x7F
defines.description: The API_LINEID_NONE is used by a PP to inform the FP that any line can be used.
